error.signature: fatal: Not possible to fast-forward, aborting.

verdict.summary: git pull with --ff-only fails because the remote branch has diverged.

dead_ends.action: Using git push -f to overwrite remote
dead_ends.why_fails: Destroys remote history; other collaborators lose work

dead_ends.action: Deleting the local branch and re-checking out

workarounds.action: Use git pull --rebase to replay local commits on top of remote
workarounds.how: git pull --rebase origin main — creates linear history

workarounds.action: Use git pull (merge) if you want a merge commit
workarounds.how: git pull origin main — creates a merge commit preserving both histories

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'fatal' is a merge error while 'error' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
